member.name: T:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Node
member.summary: The remainder of the model has three lines per node, for M nodes (where M is the number of match states, As given by the LENG line). These three lines are (K Is the alphabet size In residues)

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Node.Match
member.summary: [Match emission line] The first field is the node number (1 : : :M). The parser verifies this number as a consistency check(it expects the nodes to come in order). The next K numbers for match emissions, one per symbol, In alphabetic order. The next field Is the MAP annotation for this node. If MAP was yes in the header, then this Is an integer, representing the alignment column index for this match state (1..alen); otherwise, this field Is '-’. The next field Is the CONS consensus residue for this node. If CONS was yes in the header, then this Is a single character, representing the consensus residue annotation For this match state; otherwise, this field Is '-’. The next field Is the RF annotation for this node. If RF was yes in the header, then this Is a single character, representing the reference annotation for this match state; otherwise, this field Is '-’. The next field Is the MM mask value for this node. If MM was yes in the header, then this Is a single 'm’ character, indicating that the position was identified as a masked position during model construction; otherwise, this field Is '-’. The next field Is the CS annotation for this node. If CS was yes, then this Is a single character, representing the consensus structure at this match state; otherwise this field Is '-’.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Node.Insert
member.summary: [Insert emission line] The K fields on this line are the insert emission scores, one per symbol, in alphabetic order.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Node.StateTransitions
member.summary: [State transition line] The seven fields on this line are the transitions for node k, in the order shown by the transition header line: Mk ! Mk+1; Ik;Dk+1; Ik ! Mk+1; Ik; Dk ! Mk+1;Dk+1. For transitions from the final node M, match state M + 1 Is interpreted as the END state E, and there Is no delete state M + 1; therefore the final Mk ! Dk+1 And Dk ! Dk+1 transitions are always * (zero probability), And the final Dk ! Mk+1 transition Is always 0.0 (probability 1.0).

member.name: M:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParserAPI.__probability(System.String)
member.summary: All probability parameters are all stored As negative natural log probabilities With five digits Of precision To the right Of the Decimal point, rounded. For example, a probability Of 0:25 Is stored as 􀀀log 0:25 = 1:38629. The special Case Of a zero probability Is stored As '*’.

member.remarks: 因为ln1=0，有些时候是0概率的，ln0会计算不出来，这个时候使用*代替

member.name: T:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser
member.summary: HMMER3/f [3.1b2 | February 2015]

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.NAME
member.summary: Model name; <s> is a single word containing no spaces or tabs. The name is normally picked up from the #=GF ID line from a Stockholm alignment file. If this Is Not present, the name Is created from the name Of the alignment file by removing any file type suffix. For example, an otherwise nameless HMM built from the alignment file rrm.slx would be named rrm. Mandatory.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.ACC
member.summary: Accession number; <s> is a one-word accession number. This is picked up from the #=GF AC line in a Stockholm format alignment. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.DESC
member.summary: Description line; <s> is a one-line free text description. This is picked up from the #=GF DE line in a Stockholm alignment file. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.LENG
member.summary: Model length; <d>, a positive nonzero integer, is the number of match states in the model. Mandatory.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.MAXL
member.summary: Max instance length; <d>, a positive nonzero integer, is the upper bound on the length at which And instance of the model Is expected to be found. Used only by nhmmer And nhmmscan. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.ALPH
member.summary: Symbol alphabet type. For biosequence analysis models, <s> is amino, DNA, or RNA (case insensitive). There are also other accepted alphabets For purposes beyond biosequence analysis, including coins, dice, and custom. This determines the symbol alphabet And the size Of the symbol emission probability distributions. If amino, the alphabet size K Is Set To 20 And the symbol alphabet to “ACDEFGHIKLMNPQRSTVWY” (alphabetic order); if DNA, the alphabet size K Is set to 4 And the symbol alphabet to “ACGT”; if RNA, the alphabet size K Is set to 4 And the symbol alphabet to “ACGU”. Mandatory.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.RF
member.summary: Reference annotation flag; <s> is either no or yes (case insensitive). If yes, the reference annotation character field For Each match state In the main model (see below) Is valid; If no, these characters are ignored. Reference column annotation Is picked up from a Stockholm alignment file's #=GC RF line. It is propagated to alignment outputs, and also may optionally be used to define consensus match columns In profile HMM construction. Optional; assumed To be no If Not present.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.MM
member.summary: Model masked flag; <s> is either no or yes (case insensitive). If yes, the model mask annotation character field For Each match state In the main model (see below) Is valid; If no, these characters are ignored. Indicates that the profile model was created such that emission probabilities at masked positions are Set To match the background frequency, rather than being Set based On observed frequencies in the alignment. Position-specific insertion And deletion rates are Not altered, even in masked regions. Optional; assumed To be no If Not present.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.CONS
member.summary: Consensus residue annotation flag; <s> is either no or yes (case insensitive). If yes, the consensus residue field For Each match state In the main model (see below) Is valid. If no, these characters are ignored. Consensus residue annotation Is determined When models are built. For models Of Single sequences, the consensus Is the same As the query sequence. For models Of multiple alignments, the consensus Is the maximum likelihood residue at Each position. Upper Case indicates that the model's emission probability for the consensus residue is an arbitrary threshold (0.5 for protein models, 0.9 for DNA/RNA models).

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.CS
member.summary: Consensus structure annotation flag; <s> is either no or yes (case insensitive). If yes, the consensus Structure character field For Each match state In the main model (see below) Is valid; If no these characters are ignored. Consensus Structure annotation Is picked up from a Stockholm file's #=GC SS_cons line, And propagated to alignment displays. Optional; assumed to be no if Not present.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.MAP
member.summary: Map annotation flag; <s> is either no or yes (case insensitive). If set to yes, the map annotation field in the main model (see below) Is valid; if no, that field will be ignored. The HMM/alignment map annotates each match state with the index of the alignment column from which it came. It can be used for quickly mapping any subsequent HMM alignment back to the original multiple alignment, via the model. Optional; assumed To be no If Not present.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.DATE
member.summary: Date the model was constructed; <s> is a free text date string. This field is only used for logging purposes.y Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.COM
member.summary: Command line log; <n> counts command line numbers, and <s> is a one-line command. There may be more than one COM line per save file, Each numbered starting from n = 1. These lines record every HMMER command that modified the save file. This helps us reproducibly And automatically log how Pfam models have been constructed, For example. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.NSEQ
member.summary: Sequence number; <d> is a nonzero positive integer, the number of sequences that the HMM was trained On. This field Is only used For logging purposes. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.EFFN
member.summary: Effective sequence number; <f> is a nonzero positive real, the effective total number of sequences determined by hmmbuild during sequence weighting, For combining observed counts With Dirichlet prior information In parameterizing the model. This field Is only used For logging purposes. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.CKSUM
member.summary: Training alignment checksum; <d> is a nonnegative unsigned 32-bit integer. This number is calculated from the training sequence data, And used In conjunction With the alignment map information to verify that a given alignment Is indeed the alignment that the map Is for. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.GA
member.summary: Pfam gathering thresholds GA1 and GA2. See Pfam documentation of GA lines. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.TC
member.summary: Pfam trusted cutoffs TC1 and TC2. See Pfam documentation of TC lines. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.NC
member.summary: Pfam noise cutoffs NC1 and NC2. See Pfam documentation of NC lines. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.STATS
member.summary: Statistical parameters needed for E-value calculations. <s1> is the model’s alignment mode configuration: currently only LOCAL Is recognized. <s2> Is the name Of the score distribution: currently MSV, VITERBI, and FORWARD are recognized. <f1> And <f2> are two realvalued parameters controlling location And slope Of Each distribution, respectively; And For Gumbel distributions For MSV And Viterbi scores, And And For exponential tails For Forward scores. values must be positive. All three lines Or none of them must be present: when all three are present, the model Is considered To be calibrated For E-value statistics. Optional.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMParser.HMM
member.summary: The first line in the main model section may be an optional line starting with COMPO: these are the model's overall average match state emission probabilities, which are used as a background residue composition In the “filter null” model. The K fields On this line are log probabilities For Each residue in the appropriate biosequence alphabet's order. Optional.

member.name: T:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.STATS
member.summary: Statistical parameters needed for E-value calculations. <s1> is the model’s alignment mode configuration: currently only LOCAL Is recognized. <s2> Is the name Of the score distribution: currently MSV, VITERBI, and FORWARD are recognized. <f1> And <f2> are two realvalued parameters controlling location And slope Of Each distribution, respectively; And For Gumbel distributions For MSV And Viterbi scores, And And For exponential tails For Forward scores. values must be positive. All three lines Or none of them must be present: when all three are present, the model Is considered To be calibrated For E-value statistics. Optional.

member.name: M:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMCompares.Equals(SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMM,SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMM,System.Double)
member.summary: 计算HMM模型的相似度

member.name: T:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Stockholm
member.summary: Pfam-A.hmm.dat

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Stockholm.ID
member.summary: Identifier

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Stockholm.AC
member.summary: Pfam accession ID

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Stockholm.DE
member.summary: Definition

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.Stockholm.TP
member.summary: Type

member.name: T:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct
member.summary: Structure containing information for an HMM profile retrieved from the PFAM database.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.Name
member.summary: The protein family name (unique identifier) Of the HMM profile record In the PFAM database.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.PfamAccessionNumber
member.summary: The protein family accession number Of the HMM profile record In the PFAM database.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.ModelDescription
member.summary: Description Of the HMM profile.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.ModelLength
member.summary: The length Of the profile (number Of MATCH states).

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.Alphabet
member.summary: The alphabet used In the model, 'AA' or 'NT'. Note: AlphaLength Is 20 for 'AA' and 4 for 'NT'.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.MatchEmission
member.summary: Symbol emission probabilities In the MATCH states. The format Is a matrix Of size -by-, where Each row corresponds To the emission distribution For a specific MATCH state.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.InsertEmission
member.summary: Symbol emission probabilities In the INSERT state. The format Is a matrix Of size ModelLength-by-AlphaLength, where Each row corresponds To the emission distribution For a specific INSERT state.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.NullEmission
member.summary: Symbol emission probabilities In the MATCH And INSERT states For the NULL model. The format Is a 1-by-AlphaLength row vector. Note: NULL probabilities are also known As the background probabilities.

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.BeginX
member.summary: BEGIN state transition probabilities. Format Is a 1-by-(ModelLength + 1) row vector [B->D1 B->M1 B->M2 B->M3 .... B->Mend]

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.MatchX
P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.InsertX
member.summary: INSERT state transition probabilities. Format Is a 2-by-(ModelLength - 1) matrix [ I1->M2 I2->M3 ... I[end-1]->Mend; I1->I1 I2->I2 ... I[end-1]->I[end-1] ]

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.DeleteX
member.summary: DELETE state transition probabilities. Format Is a 2-by-(ModelLength - 1) matrix [ D1->M2 D2->M3 ... D[end-1]->Mend ; D1->D2 D2->D3 ... D[end-1]->Dend ]

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.FlankingInsertX
member.summary: Flanking insert states (N And C) used For LOCAL profile alignment. Format Is a 2-by-2 matrix [N->B C->T ; N->N C->C]

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.LoopX
member.summary: Loop states transition probabilities used for multiple hits alignment. Format Is a 2-by-2 matrix [E->C J->B ; E->J J->J]

member.name: P:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.HMMStruct.NullX
member.summary: Null transition probabilities used To provide scores With log-odds values also For state transitions. Format Is a 2-by-1 column vector [G->F ; G->G]

member.name: T:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.DBI
member.summary: Retrieve hidden Markov model (HMM) profile from PFAM database

member.name: M:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.DBI.GetHMMprof(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve hidden Markov model (HMM) profile from PFAM database
member.param: String specifying a protein family name (unique identifier) of an HMM profile record in the PFAM database. For example, '7tm_2'.

member.name: M:SMRUCC.genomics.Analysis.SequenceTools.Sanger.PfamHMMScan.DBI.GetHMMprof(System.Int32)
member.summary: HMMStruct = gethmmprof(PFAMNumber) determines a protein family accession number from PFAMNumber (an integer), searches the PFAM database for the associated record, retrieves the HMM profile information, and stores it in HMMStruct, a MATLAB structure.
member.param: Integer specifying a protein family number of an HMM profile record in the PFAM database. For example, 2 is the protein family number for the protein family 'PF00002'.
